value.name: Tablespoon - Wikipedia
value.snippet: A tablespoon (tbsp. , Tbsp. , Tb. , or T.) is a large spoon. In many English-speaking regions, the term now refers to a large spoon used for serving; however, in some regions, it is the largest type of spoon used for eating. By extension, the term is also used as a cooking measure of volume.

value.name: Convert tablespoon [metric] to gram
value.snippet: We assume you are converting between tablespoon [metric] and gram [water]. You can view more details on each measurement unit: tablespoon [metric] or gram The SI derived unit for volume is the cubic meter. 1 cubic meter is equal to 66666.666666667 tablespoon [metric], or 1000000 gram.

value.name: Tablespoons to Milliliters (mL) Conversion
value.snippet: There are 14.7867648 mL in a tablespoon. To convert tablespoons to mL, multiply the tablespoon value by 14.7867648. For example, to find out how many mL in a tablespoon and a half, multiply 1.5 by 14.7867648, that makes 22.18 mL in 1.5 tablespoons. tablespoons to mL formula mL = tablespoon * 14.7867648 How to convert milliliters to tablespoons?

value.name: Common Metric Conversions for Cooking - The Spruce Eats
value.snippet: Yes, those teaspoons and tablespoons are all part of this system, too. While we find the imperial system familiar as part of our culinary culture, it is not a common system for the rest of the world. In fact, only three countries continue to use this system of measurement: the United States, Liberia, and Myanmar.

value.name: Tablespoons and Cup Sizes Around The World - The Calculator Site
value.snippet: 1 US cup (recipes) = 16 US tablespoons; 1 US cup (recipes) = 15.77 metric tablespoons (UK, international) The US legal cup. The US legal cup is the measurement commonly used in nutrition labelling, as stipulated by the FDA in their (Food Labelling Guidelines). Measurements for the US legal cup (used in nutrition labelling) 1 US cup (nutrition) = 240 mL

value.snippet: The metric tablespoon is a unit of measurement of volume Metric tablespoon is a metric (SI) liquid measure of volume.
